Week of October 12, 2015 <http://www.launchmw.com/?mkt_tok=3RkMMJWWfF9wsRomrfCcI63Em2iQPJWpsrB0B%2FDC18kX3RUvIrufawfind1SFJk7a8C6XFRCRt1I9SYVSrDM#mwiot?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-10-12-15> Transforming How the World Builds Software Pivotal is the Presenting Sponsor for Launch M/W/IoT this year. The conference features over 40 talks - including a co-keynote by Sunny Madra <https://twitter.com/sundeep>, design talk by Tim McCoy, diversity talk by Cornelia Davis <https://twitter.com/cdavisafc>, and a panel and startup judging with Janice Fraser <https://twitter.com/clevergirl>. We also have sponsored multiple talks by Pivotal customers and prospects. The event is expected to house close to 2,000 founders, developers, investors, and senior executives. READ MORE <http://www.launchmw.com/?mkt_tok=3RkMMJWWfF9wsRomrfCcI63Em2iQPJWpsrB0B%2FDC18kX3RUvIrufawfind1SFJk7a8C6XFRCRt1I9SYVSrDM#mwiot?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-10-12-15> Pivotal Cloud Foundry The Cloud Native Journey: Enterprise Transformation (Part 4) October 8, 2015
In this post, Coté provides his fourth piece on The Cloud Native Journey. Having previously covered three topics—an introduction that included reasons for the journey, the cloud native development of new apps, and migrating legacy apps to Cloud Native architectures, he dives into organizations looking to completely transform into a Cloud Native IT department and business. There is plenty logic, references, and links to explain the shift, focusing on the meatware problem—people.
Read More <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/features/the-cloud-native-journey-enterprise-transformation-part-4?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-10-12-15> Decoding the Monolith October 14, 2015
The first challenge most enterprises face on their Journey to Cloud Native architectural transformation is the Monolith. As the name implies, these large applications can be difficult to envision in a Cloud Native environment. This week we share some tips on how to approach it, tangible steps you can take, and some salient lessons from history.
Tune In <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-perspectives/features/decoding-the-monolith?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-10-12-15> Data Science Multivariate Time Series Forecasting for Virtual Machine Capacity Planning October 7, 2015 In this blog, we continue our blog series on multivariate time series to apply this modeling approaches for forecasting virtual machine capacity planning. This technique can be broadly applied to other areas as well such as monitoring industrial equipment or vehicle engines.
